concept.title: Hadoop FS
concept.shortdesc: The Hadoop FS destination writes data to the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). You can write the data to HDFS as flat files or Hadoop sequence files.

conbody.p: Hadoop FS destinationoverviewdestinationsHadoop FSWhen you configure a Hadoop FS destination, you can define a directory template and time basis to determine the output directories that the destination creates and the files where records are written.

As part of the Hive Drift Solution, you can alternatively use record header attributes to indicate where to write records. You can also use record header attributes to determine the Avro schema to use and when to roll files.

You can define a file prefix, the data time zone, and properties that define when the destination closes a file. You can specify the amount of time that a record can be written to its associated directory and what happens to late records.
You can use Gzip, Bzip2, Snappy, LZ4, and other compression formats to write output files. Make sure changes in Hadoop FS topics go into MapR FS.
